headline.main: Startling Disclosures--African Slave Trade Opened at the South.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some startling and significant facts have come to our knowledge. We Save hesitated to disclose them--but, after inquiry, examination and consultation, we are convinced that both duty and policy demand disclosure. The facts. we say, are startling; they are crucial.

docs.snippet: BUCKSTONE'S immortal Adelphi piece, the "Green Bushes," was successfully revived by Miss KEENE on Wednesday night, and with the sanction of one of the largest houses of the season. The drama is too well known to need analytical discus. sion-it is one...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUCKSTONE'S immortal Adelphi piece, the "Green Bushes," was successfully revived by Miss KEENE on Wednesday night, and with the sanction of one of the largest houses of the season. The drama is too well known to need analytical discus. sion-it is one of the best of its kind, and affords abundant opportunities for the principal artists of a company like Miss KEENE'S.

docs.snippet: It is a maxim of moral pathology that depraved natures always avenge the faults of their enemiesupon the persons of their friends, and poor BENNETT has just given us a signal illustration of the truth of this painful doctrine.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is a maxim of moral pathology that depraved natures always avenge the faults of their enemiesupon the persons of their friends, and poor BENNETT has just given us a signal illustration of the truth of this painful doctrine.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM ALBANY.; The Sanitory Police Bill--Unclaimed Dividends--Potition for a Constitutional Convention--Legislation for arrived Women--Anti-Free Pass Bill--Gossip. Chargee of Corruption in Connection with Senator Spinola's Brooklyn Assessment Bill. ASSEMBLY SENATE NEW-YORK LEGISLATURE.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the House this morning, we has some proceedings that should attract the attention ot the public. Senator SPINOLA'S Brooklyn Assessment bill came down from the Senate with a non-concurrence In the amendments which the House had made to it. A motion was made to adhere to the amendments, and to ask for a Conference Committee.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; LATE DISPATCHES FROM COL. JOHNSTON. The Great Pacific Mail Route--Organization of the Territory of Arizona--Postmaster at Chicago, &c.. Orders from General Scott Relative to the Utah Expedition. INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON.. By Telegraph to the New-York Times. Magnetic Telegraph Co.'s Offices...No. 43 Wall-st., and 181 Broadway

docs.lead_paragraph: The contractors for the great overland Pacific Mail are here, after additional legislation for their benefit. It is very questionable whether it can be obtained. They are bound by contract to have their line In active operation by September next, and if they fail the contract will be assuredly forfeited. The prospect, I regret to say, is not very flartering.

docs.snippet: Further News by the America. We obtain some further European intelligence from our fies by the America, whose arrival at Boston was announced in yesterday's impression. The Brussels correspondent of the London News says that in political circles...
docs.lead_paragraph: Further News by the America. We obtain some further European intelligence from our fies by the America, whose arrival at Boston was announced in yesterday's impression. The Brussels correspondent of the London News says that in political circles there is much talk about a projected expedition against Morocco.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE MOSES TAYLOR.; The Cass-Herran Treaty Before the New Granadian Congress, LATER FROM SOUTH AMERICA. TWO Weeks Laler from California and Oregon. Ratification of the Vissari Treaty. $164,429 in Treasure. INTERESTING FROM CENTRAL AMERICA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Moses Taylor, JOHN McGOWAN, Esq., Commanding, from Aspinwall via Jamaica, with the California mails of the 5th inst., and $1,600,000 in treasure, arrived at this port on Saturday afternoon. The Moses Taylor left the wharf at Aspinwall at 2 P. M. on the 19th inst.; arrived at the wharf at Kingston, (Jamaica,) at 1 1/2 P. M. 21st; coaled, and left same evening at 9 P. M.
